alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 8:50PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Texas, including the following county, El Paso. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 749 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Near Vinton and Westway. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Near Vinton and Westway is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... West El Paso, Westway, Vinton and Franklin Mountains State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
